title: Case 1: Cyber Espionage Incident
summary: A state-sponsored actor infiltrated a corporate network via phishing emails. Evidence includes IP logs from Russia and encrypted data exfiltration.
details: Forensic analysis revealed spear-phishing emails with malicious attachments. Network traffic showed 2.5GB data transfer to foreign servers. Malware signature matches APT28 toolkit. Recommendations: Implement multi-factor authentication and employee training.

title: Case 2: Data Breach at Financial Firm
summary: Unauthorized access to customer databases led to theft of 500K records. Attack vector: SQL injection vulnerability in web app.
details: Log files showed repeated failed logins followed by successful injection. Stolen data included PII and credit card info sold on dark web. Chain of custody maintained for all artifacts. Recommendations: Regular code audits and WAF deployment.

title: Case 3: Ransomware Malware Infection
summary: Ransomware encrypted critical files on a hospital server. Payload delivered via infected USB drive from an insider threat.

locations.desc: Infection Source - San Francisco, USA (Employee Home)

details: Hash analysis matched Ryuk ransomware variant. Volatility memory dumps revealed persistence mechanisms. No exfiltration detected, but backups were hit. Forensic imaging completed within 24 hours. Recommendations: Air-gapped backups and USB restrictions.
